chargeHist.descr: Strangulation and Suffocation (with a Previous Conviction)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Maihe Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melvin Maihe Malone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melvin Maihe Malone was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Melvin Maihe Malone was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in custody. Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to 15CF2869 and concurrent to Count 3; straight time with credit for 0 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to 15CF2869 and concurrent to Count 1; straight time; with credit for 0 days time served. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 08/01/2018. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done and pay costs and DNA surcharge.

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
MOTION IN LIMINE TO HOLD HEARING TO DETERMINE THE ADMISSIBILITY OF PRIOR RECORDS OF THE DEFENDANT AND OF ANY WITNESSES, FILED
MOTION AND NOTICE OF MOTION TO DISMISAL, FILED

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

As to Counts 1 and 3 as Amended:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Deputy Clerk DAN  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.

Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court ordered 

Count 1 amended to: Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 3 amended to: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Melvin Maihe Malone not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case calendared for jury trial today.  Both parties advised the Court that they are ready to proceed.  Parties discussed how the trial will proceed.  Case passed.
Order to:  Produce entered for scannig purposes
Court advised defendant that the No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with TONY H., SHIRLEY H., KR (6/9/01) AND KMR (9/7/04).

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Absolute sobriety to be monitored by drug testing.  Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew).  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with 15CF2869.  In-chambers discussion placed on the record.  For reasons stated on the record, the jury trial is set out of the speedy trial demand time frame.  Defense requesting defendant to be released on a signature bond.  Arguments heard.    Bail motion by defense  granted by the Court.  Bail $5,000.00.

Case remains scheduled for Jury Trial on June 20, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.

Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  For reasons stated on the record, Court is unable to proceed with jury trial.  Arguments heard as to speedy trial demand.  Court orders case adjourned for bail/bond hearing and jury trial.  Case adjourned to Br 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court has been on standby for a jury panel.  Due to the lateness of the hour, Court orders case adjourned for Jury Trial to Branch 45 on 4-12-2016 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Melvin Maihe Malone in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Melvin Maihe Malone not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Melvin Maihe Malone not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is set for trial on 1-25-2016.  The defense has no challenges to the forensic interviews that the state will be introducing.

The state is prepared to proceed and has witnesses on call, but has no objection to the adjournment.  The court will grant adjournment.  Case set for final pretrial on 1-7-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 1-25-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Parties are requesting a final pretrial and trial date.   Case set for final pretrial on 10-1-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-19-2015 at 8:15am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Richard PoulsonJr., appeared in court for defendant, Melvin Maihe Malone.  Defendant, Melvin Maihe Malone not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The following co-defendant cases were called simultaneously: Cases 2015CF2207, 2015CF2208 and 2015CF2209.    
DEMAND for Speedy Trial was entered on 5-22-2015 for case 2015CF2208.   
Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by counsel, Court ordered the following cases CONSOLIDATED for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF2207, 2015CF2208 and 2015CF2209.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-28-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-3-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Court vacates the Pretrial Conference date of 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.   mld

BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Kempen.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
